page.title: 09The village hall & Library
page.content:
Coxheath village hall was opened in the early 1970's, the necessary monies being raised in the area and not much having been given in grants. The building is on the site of the old burial ground for the Coxheath Workhouse. Today the hall serves all sections of the community from pre-school playgroups through ballet, judo, badminton and other activities up to indoor bowls for senior citizens.
The library was opened in 1984 to replace a small library in the Village Hall. It is situated on the corner of the school grounds and Heath Road. The library has the distinction of being the first library in Kent to have been purpose-built with a computerised issuing system, rather than the old manual system.
